DataElement.preferredName: Miniscrew Temporary Anchorage Device Surgical Procedure Complication Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A small screw of between 6-14mm in length placed between the roots of a tooth for purposes of anchoring the tooth during orthodonic treatment._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A small screw of between 6-14mm in length placed between the roots of a tooth for purposes of anchoring the tooth during orthodonic treatment._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A small screw of between 6-14mm in length placed between the roots of a tooth for purposes of anchoring the tooth during orthodonic treatment.

Property.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.
